product.text:
The Sword in the Stone

Based on the classic 1963 animated Disney film, this magical tale recounts the journey of a young orphan named Wart. The narrative follows his encounter with Merlin, a marvelous wizard, and Merlin’s pet owl, Archimedes. Through the teachings of Merlin and Archimedes, Wart sets his “sights on the heights” and learns valuable lessons in intellect, wisdom, and love. Wart then uses his newfound knowledge to do what no mighty knight has done before when he pulls the sword from the stone and becomes king.

Tie-in Activity: Introduce your child to the inspirational, real-life stories of children who made their mark on history with their vision, courage, and perseverance. Include discussions of figures like Helen Keller, Pocahontas, Iqbal Masih, and Sadako Sasaki.
